text: The Linen Loincloth
Thus Yahweh said to me: “Go and buy for yourself a loincloth of linen and put it on your loins, but you must not ⸤place⸥\f + \fr 13:1 \ft Literally “bring” \f* it in water.”
So I bought the loincloth according to the word of Yahweh and I put \add it\add*\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* on my loins.
Now the word of Yahweh came to me a second \add time\add*, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 13:3 \ft Literally “to say” \f*
“Take the loincloth that you bought, that \add is\add* on your loins, and stand up, go \add to the\add* Euphrates and hide it there in the cleft of the rock.”
So I went and hid it by \add the\add* Euphrates just as Yahweh had commanded me.

⸤And then⸥,\f + \fr 13:6 \ft Literally “And it happened” \f* ⸤after a long time⸥,\f + \fr 13:6 \ft Literally “from the end of many days” \f* then Yahweh said to me, “Stand up, go \add to the\add* Euphrates and take from there the loincloth that I commanded you to hide there.”
Then I went \add to the\add* Euphrates and I dug, and I took the loincloth from the place where I had hidden it, and look, the loincloth was ruined; it was not good for anything.
⸤And then⸥\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Literally “And it happened” \f* the word of Yahweh came to me, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Literally “to say” \f*
“Thus says Yahweh: ‘So I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.

This evil people, who refuse to listen to my words, who go\f + \fr 13:10 \ft Or “walk” \f* in the stubbornness of their hearts,\f + \fr 13:10 \ft Hebrew “heart” \f* and have gone after other gods, to serve them, and to bow in worship to them, let them be like this loincloth which is not good for anything.

For as the loincloth clings to \add the\add* loins of a person, so I caused to cling to me all the house of Israel and all the house of Judah,’ ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, ‘to be for me a people, and a name, and a praise, and a glory, but they would not listen.’

“Therefore, you shall say to them this word, ‘Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: “Every jar must be filled with wine.” ’ And they will say to you, ‘Do we not certainly know that every jar should be filled with wine?’

Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says Yahweh: “Look, I \add am\add* about to fill all the inhabitants of this land, and the kings who sit on David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem \add with\add* drunkenness.

And I will smash them, each one against his brother, and the fathers and the sons together,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh. “I will not have compassion, and I will not take pity, and I will not show compassion from destroying them.” ’ ”
Listen, and pay attention,
you must not be haughty, for Yahweh has spoken.
Give glory to Yahweh your God ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 13:16 \ft Literally “at not yet” \f* he brings darkness,
and ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 13:16 \ft Literally “at not yet” \f* your feet stumble on the mountains at twilight.
And you will hope for light, but he makes it as gloom,
he makes \add it\add*\f + \fr 13:16 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* as thick darkness.
But if you will not listen to it,
my inner self\f + \fr 13:17 \ft Or “soul” \f* will weep in secret places,
because of ⸤the presence of⸥\f + \fr 13:17 \ft Literally “the face of” \f* \add your\add* pride.
And my eyes\f + \fr 13:17 \ft Hebrew “eye” \f* will weep bitterly,
and they will melt \add in\add* tears,
because the flock of Yahweh has been taken captive.
A Message for the King and the Queen Mother
“Say to the king and to the queen mother, ‘⸤Take a lower seat⸥,\f + \fr 13:18 \ft Literally “Bring low sit” \f*
for ⸤your beautiful crown⸥\f + \fr 13:18 \ft Literally “the crown of your beauty” \f* has come down from your head.’\f + \fr 13:18 \ft Or “at the head of you” \f*
The towns of the Negev are shut up,
and there is no \add one who\add* opens \add them\add*.\f + \fr 13:19 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
All of Judah is deported;
it is deported \add in\add* completeness.
Lift up your eyes
and see those coming from \add the\add* north.
Where \add is\add* the flock that was given to you,
⸤your magnificent flock⸥?\f + \fr 13:20 \ft Literally “the flock of your splendor” \f*
What will you say when he sets over you—
and you have taught them—allies as head over you?
Will not labor pains take hold of you,
like a woman giving birth?
And if you say in your heart,
‘Why have these \add things\add* happened to me?’
Because of the greatness of your iniquity your skirts are uncovered;
your heels have endured violence.
Can a Cushite change his skin,
or a leopard his spots?
\add Then\add* you also will be able to do good,
\add who\add* are accustomed to doing evil.
And I will scatter them
like stubble scattered by \add the\add* wind of \add the\add* desert.\f + \fr 13:24 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
This \add is\add* your lot,
the portion of your measure from me,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 13:25 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“because you have forgotten me,
and you have trusted in the lie.
So in turn I will bare your skirts over your face,
and your shame will become visible.
Your adulteries, and your neighings,
the shameful behavior of your fornications
on \add the\add* hills in the countryside,
I have seen your abominations.
Woe to you, \add O\add* Jerusalem!
⸤How long will you continue to be unclean⸥?\f + \fr 13:27 \ft Literally “Not you are clean after how long still” \f*”
